chart_metadata.name: deluge
chart_metadata.description: Deluge is a lightweight, Free Software, cross-platform BitTorrent client.

runAsContext.description: Deluge requires root privileges to start the Deluge process

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Deluge is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Deluge is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Deluge is able bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Deluge is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Deluge is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Deluge

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Deluge.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: he user id that Deluge files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Deluge files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description:
The port for the Deluge Web UI.</br>
(The internal port is always 8112)

attrs.label: Expose Daemon Port
attrs.description: Expose the Deluge Daemon port

attrs.label: Daemon Port
attrs.description:
The port for the Deluge Daemon.</br>
(Internal port is always 58846)

attrs.label: Torrent Port
attrs.description:
The port for the Deluge Torrent.</br>
Applies to both TCP and UDP.

attrs.label: Deluge Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Deluge Configuration.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Deluge.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Deluge.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.6.app_readme:
Deluge

Deluge is a lightweight, Free Software, cross-platform BitTorrent client.
1.2.6.detailed_readme:
Deluge

Deluge is a lightweight, Free Software, cross-platform BitTorrent client.
